about.description:
ngspice is the open source spice simulator for electric and electronic circuits.

Such a circuit may comprise of JFETs, bipolar and MOS transistors, passive elements
like R, L, or C, diodes, transmission lines and other devices, all interconnected
in a netlist. Digital circuits are simulated as well, event driven and fast, from
single gates to complex circuits. And you may enter the combination of both analog
and digital as a mixed-signal circuit.

ngspice offers a wealth of device models for active, passive, analog, and digital
elements. Model parameters are provided by the semiconductor manufacturers.
The user add her circuits as a netlist, and the output is one or more graphs of
currents, voltages and other electrical quantities or is saved in a data file.

Note:
  This build was configured with `--enable-xspice --enable-cider --enable=openmp`
  See the [build script](https://git.io/JfVZX) for more specifics.
about.summary: The open source spice simulator for electric and electronic circuits

name: ngspice-exe
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.19.2
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
    name: ngspice-exe
    version: '30'
source:
    patches:
        - patches/libtoolize-name.patch
    sha256: 08fe0e2f3768059411328a33e736df441d7e6e7304f8dad0ed5f28e15d936097
    url: https://phoenixnap.dl.sourceforge.net/project/ngspice/ng-spice-rework/old-releases/30/ngspice-30.tar.gz
build:
    noarch: false
    number: '2'
    script: build_exe.sh
    string: h93121df_2
requirements:
    build:
        - autoconf 2.69 pl526h1de35cc_9
        - automake 1.16.2 pl526_0
        - bison 3.4 h6de7cb9_1
        - cctools 927.0.2 h5ba7a2e_4
        - clang 9.0.1 default_hf57f61e_0
        - clang-tools 9.0.1 default_hf57f61e_0
        - clang_osx-64 9.0.1 h05bbb7f_0
        - clangxx 9.0.1 default_hf57f61e_0
        - compiler-rt 9.0.1 h6a512c6_3
        - compiler-rt_osx-64 9.0.1 h99342c6_3
        - flex 2.6.4 habec0da_1004
        - ld64 450.3 h3c32e8a_4
        - libcxx 10.0.0 h1af66ff_2
        - libiconv 1.15 h0b31af3_1006
        - libllvm9 9.0.1 h7475705_1
        - libtool 2.4.6 h1de35cc_1002
        - llvm-openmp 10.0.0 h28b9765_0
        - m4 1.4.18 h1de35cc_1001
        - perl 5.26.2 haec8ef5_1006
        - tapi 1000.10.8 ha1b3eb9_4
        - texinfo 6.7 pl526h51f8f69_0
        - zlib 1.2.11 h0b31af3_1006
    host:
        - gettext 0.19.8.1 h46ab8bc_1002
        - libcxx 10.0.0 h1af66ff_2
        - libffi 3.2.1 h4a8c4bd_1007
        - libiconv 1.15 h0b31af3_1006
        - libxcb 1.13 h1de35cc_1002
        - llvm-openmp 10.0.0 h28b9765_0
        - ncurses 6.1 h0a44026_1002
        - pthread-stubs 0.4 h1de35cc_1001
        - readline 8.0 hcfe32e1_0
        - xorg-kbproto 1.0.7 h1de35cc_1002
        - xorg-libice 1.0.10 h01d97ff_0
        - xorg-libsm 1.2.3 h01d97ff_1000
        - xorg-libx11 1.6.9 h0b31af3_0
        - xorg-libxau 1.0.9 h1de35cc_0
        - xorg-libxaw 1.0.13 h1de35cc_1002
        - xorg-libxdmcp 1.1.3 h01d97ff_0
        - xorg-libxext 1.3.4 h01d97ff_0
        - xorg-libxmu 1.1.3 h0b31af3_0
        - xorg-libxpm 3.5.13 h0b31af3_0
        - xorg-libxt 1.1.5 h01d97ff_1003
        - xorg-xextproto 7.3.0 h1de35cc_1002
        - xorg-xproto 7.0.31 h1de35cc_1007
    run:
        - llvm-openmp >=10.0.0
        - ncurses >=6.1,<6.2.0a0
        - readline >=8.0,<9.0a0
        - readline >=8.0,<9.0a0
        - xorg-libx11
        - xorg-libxaw
        - xorg-libxt
test:
    commands:
        - $PREFIX/bin/ngspice --version
        - $PREFIX/bin/ngspice -b -r /tmp/raw.out test-files/test.cir
    files: test-files
about:
    description: "ngspice is the open source spice simulator for electric and electronic\
        \ circuits.\n\nSuch a circuit may comprise of JFETs, bipolar and MOS transistors,\
        \ passive elements\nlike R, L, or C, diodes, transmission lines and other\
        \ devices, all interconnected\nin a netlist. Digital circuits are simulated\
        \ as well, event driven and fast, from\nsingle gates to complex circuits.\
        \ And you may enter the combination of both analog\nand digital as a mixed-signal\
        \ circuit.\n\nngspice offers a wealth of device models for active, passive,\
        \ analog, and digital\nelements. Model parameters are provided by the semiconductor\
        \ manufacturers.\nThe user add her circuits as a netlist, and the output is\
        \ one or more graphs of\ncurrents, voltages and other electrical quantities\
        \ or is saved in a data file.\n\nNote:\n  This build was configured with `--enable-xspice\
        \ --enable-cider --enable=openmp`\n  See the [build script](https://git.io/JfVZX)\
        \ for more specifics.\n"
    dev_url: http://ngspice.sourceforge.net/devel.html
    doc_url: http://ngspice.sourceforge.net/docs.html
    home: http://ngspice.sourceforge.net
    license: BSD-3-Clause
    license_family: BSD
    license_file: COPYING
    summary: The open source spice simulator for electric and electronic circuits
extra:
    copy_test_source_files: true
    final: true
    recipe-maintainers:
        - stuarteberg
